prompt:
Process this BHW WTB post:

WTB: Niche Edits - Finance Niche
Budget: $80-120 per link
Need 15 links for credit card comparison site
DR 30+ sites
TAT: 3 weeks
Payment: PayPal, 50% upfront 50% on delivery
PM me if you can deliver
expectations: Extracts budget ($80-120 per link, $1200-1800 total)
Identifies clear scope (15 niche edits, finance, DR30+)
Notes timeline (3 weeks) and payment terms (50/50)
Classifies as BUY with high confidence
Creates complete offer with fixed-price tiers
Offer includes what's included and NOT included
Provides clear next step/CTA
Deal summary is one paragraph
Entire output enables decision in ≤2 minutes

prompt:
Here's an inquiry I got:

Hi, I need my website to rank #1 on Google for 'insurance' and 'loans' within 2 weeks. My budget is $200 total. Can you guarantee these rankings? I need proof you can do this before I pay anything. Let me know.
expectations: Identifies unrealistic expectations (2 weeks for ultra-competitive keywords)
Flags insufficient budget ($200 for enterprise-level keywords)
Catches guarantee demand as red flag
Notes proof/free work request as red flag
Classifies as REJECT with high confidence
Provides brief decline template or recommends ignore
Deal summary explains why this is not viable
Does not waste time creating an offer

prompt:
Lead from email:

Subject: Link Building Help

Hi, I run an e-commerce site selling fitness equipment. Our organic traffic has been declining and I think we need backlinks. What do you charge and what would you recommend? Looking to get started soon.

Thanks,
Mike
expectations: Identifies legitimate pain point (declining traffic)
Notes urgency signal (wants to start soon)
Recognizes missing information (budget, specific goals)
Classifies as NURTURE
Asks 1-2 qualifying questions (budget range, specific goals)
Questions are clear and easy to answer
Does not create full offer yet
Explains that offer will come after clarity

prompt:
BHW WTB post:

WTB: Backlinks (CHEAP!!!)
Need 500 backlinks ASAP
Budget: $50 MAX
Must see samples first (free)
Will leave review if links work
Pay after I see rankings improve
DM fast
expectations: Identifies multiple red flags (unrealistic quantity/budget, free sample demand, pay-after-results)
Notes aggressive tone ('CHEAP!!!', 'DM fast')
Recognizes impossible budget ($50 for 500 links)
Classifies as REJECT
High confidence rejection
Recommends ignore (no need to respond)
Deal summary explains red flag combo
Does not attempt to salvage this lead

prompt:
Email lead:

Hello,

I'm the marketing director at a SaaS company (projectmanagement.io). We're looking to build high-quality backlinks to improve our domain authority and rankings for key product terms.

Scope: 25-30 guest posts on relevant B2B/tech sites
Timeline: 60-90 days
Budget: $5,000-7,500

We need sites with real traffic and editorial standards. Can you provide a proposal?

Best,
Sarah Chen
Marketing Director
expectations: Recognizes professional communication and title
Extracts clear budget ($5k-7.5k), scope (25-30 guest posts), timeline (60-90 days)
Notes quality signals (wants real traffic, editorial standards)
Classifies as BUY with high confidence
Creates professional offer matching their budget range
Offer includes tiered options within budget
Addresses their quality requirements explicitly
Professional tone matching their communication level

prompt:
Chat log from Discord:

User: Hey I need SEO help for my site
User: Actually I need links AND content
User: Oh and can you do social media too?
User: And fix my site speed
User: Budget is around $500/month
User: Can you do all that?
expectations: Identifies scope creep pattern (constantly adding services)
Notes budget ($500/month) vs. expanding scope
Recognizes need for scope clarification
Classifies as NURTURE
Asks to prioritize what's most important
Attempts to narrow scope to fit budget
Sets boundaries on what $500 can cover
Does not accept undefined expanding scope

prompt:
Lead form submission:

Business: Martinez Dental Clinic
Location: Austin, TX
Request: Need to rank higher on Google for 'dentist Austin' and related terms. Currently on page 2-3. Losing patients to competitors on page 1.
Budget: $1,500-2,500/month
Timeline: Want to see improvement in 3-4 months
Phone: Provided
Email: Provided
expectations: Extracts local business context (dentist, Austin)
Identifies clear pain point (losing patients to competitors)
Notes realistic budget ($1.5-2.5k/month) and timeline (3-4 months)
Recognizes this is qualified local SEO lead
Classifies as BUY
Creates offer focused on local SEO (citations, local links, GMB)
Timeline in offer matches their 3-4 month expectation
Addresses competitive displacement pain point

prompt:
Email thread (5th email from prospect):

Thanks for the proposal. A few more questions:
- Can you provide case studies from exactly my niche?
- What's your exact link placement process?
- How do you source writers?
- Can I approve every site before you post?
- What if I don't like the content?
- Can we do a trial month first?
- Will you provide weekly reports?
- What happens if rankings don't improve?

I'm comparing 12 different agencies so need all this info before deciding. Also still not sure about budget - can you give me 3 more pricing options?

Thanks
expectations: Identifies analysis paralysis (excessive questions, 5th email, comparing 12 agencies)
Notes indecision signals (still unsure about budget)
Recognizes time-waster pattern
Classifies as REJECT or deprioritize
Recommends either brief response or move on
Does not invest more time answering questions
Notes that conversion probability is very low
Suggests focusing on ready-to-buy leads instead

prompt:
Process this:

Hey, we're a startup that just raised Series A. Need to scale up our content and backlink strategy. We're seeing our competitors rank for all the keywords we want. Revenue is around $2M ARR, growing 20% MoM. Team of 15. What can you do for us?
expectations: Infers budget capability from context (Series A, $2M ARR, team of 15)
Recognizes competitive pressure as urgency signal
Notes scale-up language suggests larger budget
Classifies as NURTURE (budget not stated but high potential)
Asks about budget range appropriate for their stage
Creates offer framework ready to adjust to budget
Treats as high-value prospect worth clarifying
Does not assume low budget based on startup label

prompt: Simple lead: I need 10 guest posts for my travel blog. Budget $100 per post. Can start next week.
expectations: Outputs in exact format specified: Deal Summary, Recommendation, Offer/Response
Deal summary is one paragraph (3-4 sentences max)
Recommendation includes classification (BUY/NURTURE/REJECT), reasoning, confidence, action
Offer (if BUY) includes all required elements: included, not included, investment, timeline, CTA
Uses visual separators/formatting for clarity
Entire output is scannable in ≤2 minutes
Classification is unambiguous
Action step is clear and specific

prompt: Quick message on BHW: Need links. DM me.
expectations: Recognizes extreme lack of information
Makes reasonable assumptions or notes what's missing
Likely classifies as NURTURE or low-priority
Asks for minimum critical info (budget, scope, timeline)
Does not spend time creating detailed offer without info
Notes assumptions in deal summary
Keeps response brief matching their brief inquiry
